title: unexpected behavior when resize shape include 0s.
body_html:
The resizes interpret size by stopping at the first 0, which leads to some unexpected results:

>>> torch.ones(1,0)

 1
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]

>>> torch.ones(1,0,3)

 1
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]

>>> torch.ones(0,3)
[torch.FloatTensor with no dimension]

Given that we want to add 0-dimensional scalars (#1433), it would be nice to clean this up. I propose that including a 0 in a size (besides the 1-element case) should be an error. That way, in the case of success, the resulting size is always the requested size.

body:
The resizes interpret size by stopping at the first 0, which leads to some unexpected results:
```
>>> torch.ones(1,0)

 1
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]

>>> torch.ones(1,0,3)

 1
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]

>>> torch.ones(0,3)
[torch.FloatTensor with no dimension]
```

Given that we want to add 0-dimensional scalars (https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/1433), it would be nice to clean this up.  I propose that including a 0 in a size (besides the 1-element case) should be an error.  That way, in the case of success, the resulting size is always the requested size.
